Crop & Weather (For the period 19th  - 26th August 2025)

The Western and Nuwara Eliya planting districts experienced bright
conditions throughout the week. The Department of Meteorology
forecasts scattered showers to be expected in both regions.

Uva/Udapussellawa's experienced sunny conditions. Rain be expected
in both districts.

The Low growns reported bright conditions. Showers are to be expected
in the Low grown districts.

The Western and Nuwara Eliya's maintained their crop intakes whilst
the Uva/Udapussellawa and Low grown districts reported a decline.

This Week's Market Movement at Colombo Tea Auction

Order of Sale this week

Demand: Ex-Estate met with good demand at irregular rates. Good demand prevailed
for Low Growns.

High Grown Teas

BOP - Best Western's were mostly easier by Rs. 20-40/- per kg. In the
Below Best category, teas in the higher price bracket declined by Rs.
20-40/- per kg, whilst others held firm. Teas at the lower end of the
market were firm to dearer by a similar margin. Nuwara Eliya's were
mostly unsold. Uda Pussellawa's moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg and more.
Uva's - Seasonal teas continued to sell well between Rs. 2,400-2,900/-
per kg, whilst the non-seasonal types continued to sell around last
week's levels.

BOPF - Best Western's – A few selected high priced teas were firm to
dearer by Rs.50/- per kg, whilst others were irregular following quality.
In the Below Best category, prices for teas in the higher price bracket
were irregular following quality, whilst others sold around last week's
levels. Teas at the lower end of the market were generally firm. Nuwara
Eliya's were mostly unsold. Uda Pussellawa's were Rs. 20-40/- per kg
dearer. Uva's - Seasonal teas sold well though lower to last with prices
ranging between Rs.1,800-1,900/- per kg, whilst the non-seasonal types
continued to sell around last week's levels.

BOP1 - Select best and best moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg whilst all
others held firm.

OP1 - Select best and best moved up by Rs. 50/- per kg whilst all

maintained.

others maintained.

FBOPF1 - In general held firm.

PEKOE/PEKOE1 - Select best PEK's were firm, whilst best and below

Medium and low growns were dearer by Rs. 10-20/- per kg. CTC's

DUST Grades

DUST - Cleaner secondaries and Low growns maintained.

World Tea Production (In Million Kilos)

Sri Lanka Tea Exports – July 2025

The total quantity of tea exported for the month of July 2025 including
Re-Exports with imported Tea amounted to 24.04 Mn/kg, recording an
increase of +2.68 Mn/kg (+12.56%) compared to the same period last
year. The FOB price per Kg for the month was LKR 1,766.51 vis-à-vis
LKR 1,773.70 (-LKR 7.19). Total export earnings recorded an increase of
LKR 4.59 billion (12.11%) in 2024 as compared to the same month last
year.

Cumulative exports for the period January to July 2025 including Re-
Exports with imported Tea amounted to 150.85 Mn/kg, showing an
increase of 10.38 Mn/Kg (7.39%) compared to last year. The FOB price
per Kg for January to July 2025 recorded LKR 1,748.51 vis-à-vis LKR
1,771.45 for the corresponding period in 2024 (-LKR 22.94). Total export
value for the period under reference showed an increase of +LKR 14.92
billion (+6.00%) compared to 2024.

Equivalent USD export earnings for the cumulative period January to
July 2025 amounted to approximately USD 884.30 million compared
with 811.63 million in the same period last year showing an increase of
approximately USD 72.68 million.

Country wise analysis of exports reveals that Iraq has emerged as the
largest export destination from Sri Lanka followed by Libya and Russia.

Other Markets

Mombasa Auction of 25th / 26th August 2025

There was good general demand for 153,360 packages (10,376,062.00
kilos) on offer with 37.19% unsold.

 

Pakistan Packers were active but at lower levels with more interest
from Yemen and other Middle Eastern countries. There was maintained
participation from Afghanistan and Egyptian Packers. Kazakhstan and
other CIS states lent support with Bazaar maintaining enquiry although
were quite selective. UK were more active with Russia showing less
interest and were quite selective. Sudan and South Sudan remained
absent. Local Packers operated selectively while Somalia continued
active at the lower end of the market.

 

LEAF GRADES (M2 & M3)

 

BP1: Best – Were irregularly absorbed with select lines gaining by up to
USC39 while others were easier by up to USC41. Brighter – Firm to
easier with few invoices shedding up to USC48 while the remainder
ranged between USC10 to USC45 dearer. Mediums – KTDA mediums
were dearer with select teas advancing by up to USC10 while a few
lines eased by up to USC12; plantation mediums appreciated by up to
USC18. Lower Medium – Were firm to USC18 above previous rates.
Plainer – Steady and varied between USC8 to USC27 dearer to easier
by up to USC12.

 

PF1: Best – Met irregular interest and ranged between firm to USC24
above previous levels while some lines shed up to USC20. Brighter –
Were generally easier by up to USC20 with a few invoices gaining by
USC6 to USC24. Mediums – KTDA mediums were steady to dearer by
up to USC19 while some teas shed by USC2 to USC12. Plantation
mediums appreciated by up to USC10. Lower Medium – Were firm to
easier by up to USC17. Plainer – Some irregular interest varying
between steady to dearer by USC3 to USC11 while select lines lost up
to USC8.

 

DUST GRADES (M1)

 

PDUST: Best – Were irregular ranging between USC3 to USC11 dearer
to easier by up to USC18. Brighter – Firm to dearer by up to USC12 but
a few invoices shed up to USC8.   Mediums – KTDA mediums were
steady to USC8 dearer with a select few gaining up to USC16 to mostly
easier by up to USC17 with plantation mediums appreciating by up to
USC9.   Lower Medium – Dearer by up to USC15 but few selected teas
were firm to USC6 easier.   Plainer – Met strong support ranging
between USC14 above previous rates to easier by up to USC11.

 

DUST1: Best – Met irregular interest and varied between firm to USC18
above previous levels to easier by up to USC15.  Brighter – Were firm to
easier by up to USC7 but a select few gained by up to USC32. Mediums
– KTDA mediums met more irregular enquiry ranging between USC9 to
USC18 above previous rates to easier by USC14 with plantation
mediums up to USC9 dearer. Lower Medium – Up to USC8 dearer to
easier by up to USC4. Plainer – Some irregular interest varying between
steady to USC11 dearer to USC3 below previous rates.

 

SECONDARY GRADES (S1)

In the Secondary Catalogues, best BPs were barely steady while others
were discounted; PFs tended dearer. Clean well sorted coloury Fannings
appreciated with similar DUSTs mostly selling above previous levels.
Other Fannings held value while DUSTs gained. BMFs were well
absorbed.

(Courtesy - Africa Tea Brokers Ltd)

Bangladesh Auction of 25th August 2025

CTC LEAF: 53,076 packages of tea on offer met with a fairly good
demand.

BROKENS: Well made good liquoring BOPs were in good demand and
were generally firm on last. Smaller varieties in this category were well
sought after at generally firm rates. Medium and plain types met with a
fair demand with more withdrawals. BLF teas met with fair demand but
there were several withdrawals.

FANNINGS: All good liquoring Fannings met with a fairly good demand
but eased a little whilst Medium types met with fair interest and held
last levels. Plain types were in less demand and there were again fair
withdrawals. BLF teas met with fair demand but there were several
withdrawals.

DUST: 13,567 packages of tea on offer met with a fair demand. Good
liquoring Dusts sold at around last levels. Mediums again were an
easier market with Tk.3/- to Tk.5/- less than last. Plain/BLF Dusts
were a fair market with some withdrawals. Blenders lent strong support
with fair interest from the Loose tea buyers.

COMMENTS: Blenders were fairly active this week but there was less
competition from Loose tea buyers. As a result the absorption was less
and consequently there were more withdrawals.

Dusts were a fair market.

(Courtesy - National Brokers Limited)

Malawi Auction of 27th August 2025

There was less and selective interest at irregular rates for the 4740
packages on offer following quality.

 BP1 met strong demand and sold up to 15USC dearer.

 PF1 - Few selected invoices were firm to dearer.

 PD - Selected invoices sold 5-15USC below valuation.

 D1 tended firm to 3USC easier.

 PF1SC - N/A.

 Secondary fngs fetched 5-7USC below valuation, dusts were neglected.


(Courtesy - Tea Brokers Central Africa Limited)

Guwahati Auction of 19th August 2025

Market: CTC

Demand was just fair. All categories tended easier and with significant
withdrawals.

 

Buying Pattern: CTC.

HUL lent fair support. TCPL, Western India, North India buyers, other
blenders operated. Exporters were seen on the larger brokens.

 

Market: DUST

There was fair demand at generally easier levels and with noticeable
withdrawals.

 

Buying Pattern: DUST

HUL, TCPL, Western India, North India, other packeteers operated.

 

(Courtesy - Associated Brokers Pvt. Ltd)

Jakarta Auction of 23rd August 2025

The total CTC leaf teas sold this week was 79.62%(1211750.56kgs) of
the total offering of 1521930.25Kgs

DEMAND : Good demand.

MARKET : Best category prices were erratic closely following quality.
Good teas met with very selective demand with prices irregular and
easier and also few out lots due to want of bids. Better medium &
medium sorts ruled a barely steady to easier prices. Select blacker
fanning in this category sold dearer on competition. Plainer sorts sold
barely steady prices.

BUYING PATTERN : Regional & local buyers were fairly active on best
categories but selective on good teas. Major blenders and up country
were active on the remainders. Exporters to Russia, CIS and middle east
were active on the medium and plainer sorts. Iraqi shippers were active
on larger broken at the lower level. Major blenders picked up 42.57% of
the CTC Leaf sold.

 

ORTHODOX LEAF

DEMAND : Good Demand.

MARKET : High grown:- Well made, clean whole leaf & broken sold
dearer on competition but the lower end saw a slight decline. Fanning
grade were easier by Rs 2 to 5. Others category all teas sold at barely
steady prices.

BUYING PATTERN : CIS buyers were active on cleaner blacker
varieties along with Internal buyers. Shippers to middle east operated
on select whole leaf grades and broken. Internal were very choosy.

 

CTC DUST

DEMAND : Good demand.

MARKET : CTC dust offer this week was at 363055.22Kgs of which
337933.01kgs were sold (93.08%). Best category dust sold barely
steady. Good teas were irregular. Remainders sold fully firm to dearer
especially the finer dust.

BUYING PATTERN : Regional and local packers were selective on the
best & good teas. Exporters to Russia, Middle east continued to be
active on blacker sorts. Other up country buyers were rather choosy.

 

ORTHODOX DUST

DEMAND : Selective demand.

MARKET : High grown primary dust fetched barely steady prices.
Clean, medium grown teas sold firm dearer whilst others were
discounted. Secondaries were barely steady to easier.

BUYING PATTERN : Regional & local packers were selective on
primary dusts. Exporters were very choosy at steady to easier prices on
the secondary dusts.

 

(Courtesy - J Thomas & Company Private Limited)
